senses.ex: She signed a two-year lease on the apartment.

Tips.title: Legal Binding
Tips.description: A lease is a legal document, breaking it can have consequences.
Tips.example: Before breaking your lease, check the penalty clause.

Tips.title: Negotiable Terms
Tips.description: Terms in a lease can often be negotiated before signing.
Tips.example: You can negotiate the monthly payments before you sign the lease.

Tips.title: Specific Conditions
Tips.description: Leases include specific conditions like maintenance responsibilities.
Tips.example: The lease specifies who pays for apartment repairs.

senses.ex: The company leases out its properties to tenants.

Tips.title: Passive Income
Tips.description: Leasing as a verb can be a way to earn income from owned properties.
Tips.example: They lease out their farmland to local farmers.

Tips.title: Flexibility for Business
Tips.description: Businesses may lease equipment to adapt to changing technology.
Tips.example: The company leases the latest printers every year.

senses.ex: She decided to lease a car instead of buying one.

Tips.title: Short-Term Commitment
Tips.description: Leasing lets you use an asset for a while without buying it.
Tips.example: Leasing a car can be better if you relocate frequently.

Tips.title: Immediate Use
Tips.description: Leasing allows immediate use of an item while paying over time.
Tips.example: She leased the latest phone model right away.

senses.de: The period of time for which a contract is valid.
senses.ex: The lease on this property is about to expire.

Tips.title: Renewal Consideration
Tips.description: Near the end of a lease, decide whether to renew or vacate.
Tips.example: As his lease's end approached, he considered renewing it.

Tips.title: Market Fluctuations
Tips.description: Lease duration can affect rent price; market rates can change.
Tips.example: After his five-year lease, the rent went up due to market changes.

Agreement.wordDefinition:
An agreement is a general term that means a mutual understanding between two or more people or parties.

A lease is a specific type of agreement that refers to a contract between two parties in which one party (the landlord) allows another party (the tenant) to use their property for a specific period of time in exchange for rent.

So, while an agreement can refer to any kind of understanding between parties, a lease specifically refers to a contract for renting property.

Contract.wordDefinition:
A contract is a legally binding agreement between two parties, where they agree to do something for each other.

It can be for goods or services, and it can be for a short or long period of time. For example, if you hire a tutor for a month, you would sign a contract that lays out the details of your agreement.

A lease is a type of contract that is specifically used for renting property. It is an agreement between the landlord (owner of the property) and the tenant (person renting the property) for a set amount of time.

A contract can be used for any type of agreement, while a lease specifically refers to a rental agreement for property.

Hire.wordDefinition:
Hire means to temporarily use or employ something or someone, often in exchange for payment. For example, you can hire a car or hire a person for a job.

Lease means to rent something for a period of time, usually for a longer duration than hiring. For example, you can lease an apartment or lease a car.

You hire something or someone for a short-term use or employment, while you lease something for a longer-term rental agreement.

Let.wordDefinition:
Let means to allow someone to use something that is yours.

It can be used in various contexts such as letting someone borrow a book or letting a friend live in your spare room.

Lease is used when talking about renting property or equipment for a specified period of time while let is used in a broader sense to refer to allowing someone to use something that is yours.

Occupancy.wordDefinition:
Occupancy refers to the act of physically living or dwelling in the leased property. It does not necessarily have to be part of a lease agreement and can refer to any situation where a person is living in a particular location, such as a home or apartment.

Lease is a document that outlines the terms of a rental agreement, while occupancy refers to actually living in the rental property.

Rent.wordDefinition:
Rent usually refers to a short-term agreement, it is the money paid regularly to the landlord by someone who is occupying a property.

It is generally for a short-term solution, such as renting a room or an apartment for a few months or so.

In summary, leasing is a contract for a more extended period, and renting is a short-term agreement.

Sublet.wordDefinition:
On the other hand, subletting is when a tenant rents a property to someone else while they are still under lease with the landlord.

Subletting is usually done when the tenant needs to move out before the lease is up but still wants to avoid breaking their lease or paying extra fees.

- Sublet: when a tenant rents out a property they are already renting to someone else for part of their lease period.

Tenancy.wordDefinition:
It typically includes provisions on rent, utilities, maintenance, and other conditions of the tenancy.

Tenancy refers to the right of a person to occupy a property as a tenant. It is a broader term that encompasses the relationship between the tenant and the landlord, including both the legal and practical aspects of the tenancy.

In simpler terms, a lease is an agreement that sets out the rules of renting a property, while tenancy refers to the fact of living in and occupying that property.

Lease is applicable when you are renting a property and entering into a formal contract with a landlord, while tenancy is a more general term that applies to any situation where you are living in someone else's property as a tenant.
